author: potuz
content: Hi <@360491619402776577> I'm having trouble unmarshalling geth's `get_PayloadV2` reply with the block value. The spec says that it has to be a `QUANTITY 256bit`as such I expect the reply to be the handled on my end the same way as say `baseFeePerGas` which we unmarshal as a string. If I do treat them the same way, I can't produce any blocks. I get an error from the json unmarshaller. If I use insteafd of string `uint64` (which certainly should be the wrong type) my interop advances fine and I can propose blocks and withdraw and the such. I am not using blockvalue at all though.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Yeah I think I made an oopsie with the marshalling

author: mariusvanderwijden

content: I'll merge then unmarshalling as 64uint since I can't test nethermind yet (can't compile NET yet on arch)
